pros: Great organization; excellent pay and benefits.  The leadership is stable and the company invests in its employees.
cons: Healthcare can be stressful at times

pros: You get to make your own schedule.
cons: They pay new grads more than their employees who are currently there. They don't listen. Upper management and administration act like they care, but it all about the money. Very poor pay compared to others in the area.

pros:
Health Benefits are really good
Employees who have not been there 10+ are awesome
cons:
Toxic leadership/employees that has been there forever who can do "no wrong".

Pay
PTO
Expectations

pros: The healthcare benefits are great. So are many of the people you work with
cons: PTO is terrible, so is moral

pros: Friendly staff and pleasant work enviorment. New physical plant. Nice small town..reasonable benefits that are competitive in the industry.
cons: CEO and administration are clueless as to the needs of the providers. They are always in meetings and rarely if ever visit the workers. Their decisions regarding care of patients is more financial then about what is good. After they say they have taken the staffs viewpoint in consideration they make irrational decisions that adversely effect boh the patients and staff. Administrators never see the true side. Rather they listen to a few who make their way under their wing. Bottom line emphasis is supporting areas where a profit can be obtained.. less interested in quality care.

review_title: Priorities are very much out of order
pros: Beautiful area of country.  A few staff members are very professional and eventually, they leave  because they're not treated as the professionals they are.
cons: More value put on deocrating and such than on actual hospital mission.  Promises are not kept and capable people are kept from promotions so that they won't have to fill their jobs and find someone to do that work.   The preference is to bring in someone unqualified from outside to do the "managing". Leaders are ineffectual and incompetent.   To be in a cowboy area where it's claimed that a handshake is as good a contract, this is not the case. For that matter, they don't tend to honor what's' in writing either.   Employees wind up paying for and providing their own equipment.  Ethical behavior is discouraged if it challenges the thoughts of management.  Management is under the impression that they own all the time of their employees - even the hours not at work.  Promises are made regarding comp time that are not honored.

review_title: Good experience for learning as a graduate nurse.
job_title: Staff Nurse (RN), Outpatient Care in Cody, WY
pros: Great co-workers, teamwork, communication with other departments, and approachable physicians.
cons: Call hours were outrageous as scheduled surgeries were often on delay until surgeons finished surgeries at their private outpatient center. Frustrated patients and staff. Long days due to this issue.

pros: If you like to hunt, the area is perfect.
